title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs' European vacation with a cryptic 3-word message that fans can’t ignore
description: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: New twist in Carter Hart to Edmonton Oilers talk sparks speculation a rumor in NHL
description: New layers continue to emerge in the Carter Hart to Edmonton Oilers speculation. After NHL insider Kevin Weekes surprised fans by linking Hart to Edmonton during TSN’s Free Agent show, new local ties and past connections raise questions. As Hart awaits a July 24 verdict in the 2018 sexual assault case, the Oilers’ potential interest could ignite a major PR storm.

title: IND v ENG: Jaiswal breaks Gavaskar’s 49-year record; joins elite list with Dravid & Sehwag
description: Young India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal equaled Rahul Dravid and Virender Sehwag as the joint-fastest Indian to 2,000 Test runs, achieving the milestone in his 40th innings during the second Test against England. He also became the fastest Indian to the mark in terms of matches played, reaching it in 21 Tests.

title: Twist in Pune rape case: No forced entry, use of spray; selfie with consent
description: Pune police are investigating a rape allegation made by a 22-year-old data scientist against a supposed delivery agent. Commissioner Amitesh Kumar stated there was no forced entry or use of chemicals. The woman's friend, an IT professional, has been detained after his phone location placed him at the flat during the alleged incident.

title: Cricket | Shastri, DK or Sanga? And the best dressed commentator goes to ...
description: During the India-England Test match, a lighthearted fashion contest emerged among the Sky Sports commentary team. Michael Atherton initiated the banter by criticising Nasser Hussain's casual attire, leading to a humorous awards ceremony. Ravi Shastri ultimately claimed the title of "Best Dressed Commentator" with his stylish white jacket, celebrated for its flair and confidence.

title: At least 24 dead in Texas flash floods; homes, vehicles swept away
Kolkata horror: 'Keep room ready', Monojit told guard before assault
description: Manojit Mishra instructed a security guard to prepare a room before the law college gang rape. The guard, Pinaki Banerjee, was aware of parties in the room. He was threatened to remain silent. Other accused instructed Banerjee to leave his post. Police reconstructed the crime scene with the accused. They are investigating social media activity and Monojit's employment status.

title: Exclusive | 'They bring the best out of me' - Pogacar on rivalry with Vingegaard, Evenepoel
description: Tadej Pogacar, a strong contender after his Critérium du Dauphiné win, aims for his fourth Tour de France victory. Facing rivals like Jonas Vingegaard and Remco Evenepoel, Pogacar emphasises the importance of mental strength, nutrition, and teamwork in the demanding 21-stage race. He highlights the unique beauty and challenges of Grand Tours, fueled by his love for cycling.

title: Govt doesn't take stand on matters of faith, says MEA on Dalai succession issue
description: India has clarified its stance on the Dalai Lama's succession, stating it doesn't take a position on religious matters, despite a minister's personal support for the Dalai Lama's wishes. This comes as China cautioned India against interfering in Tibetan affairs, a comment later omitted from their official briefing transcript.

title: Raza Murad reveals Madhuri Dixit’s parents arranged her marriage after her initial failures
description: Madhuri Dixit faced a series of flops early in her career, prompting her parents to consider arranging her marriage after witnessing her struggle in the film industry. Later, she was re-launched by Subhash Ghai in Ram Lakhan, a film that transformed her career trajectory. Actor Raza Murad has cited Madhuri as an example while speaking about the role of luck in surviving the industry.

title: FIFA CWC: Neves, Cancelo break down; Neto carries special shirt in honour of Jota, Silva - watch
description: Al-Hilal players Ruben Neves and João Cancelo were inconsolable during the minute's silence for Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva who died in a car crash this week. During the FIFA Club World Cup quarter-finals, Chelsea's Pedro Neto paid tribute with a special shirt.

title: Trump's July 4 fireworks: 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' signed - Here's what it means
description: President Trump signed the "big, beautiful bill" into law, extending the 2017 tax cuts and increasing funding for border security. The legislation, passed with narrow margins in both the House and Senate, also includes major reductions in Medicaid spending and changes to SNAP benefits. It raises the debt ceiling and increases the state and local tax deduction temporarily.

title: Tom Brady’s Fourth of July tribute goes viral as he honors both America and his mother
description: Tom Brady celebrated his mother Galynn's birthday on July 4th. He posted a heartfelt tribute on Instagram. He acknowledged her strength, especially during her cancer battle. Galynn was diagnosed in 2016. She attended Super Bowl LI in 2017. Brady also recognized her initial hesitation about his football career. He credited his parents for instilling important values.

title: Amazon reaches new milestone, becomes world’s largest manufacturer and operator of…
description: Amazon has reached a milestone by deploying one million robots across its facilities and introducing "DeepFleet," a new AI model to optimize robot fleet efficiency. This move aims to reduce travel time and enhance delivery speeds. While Amazon emphasizes robots working alongside humans and creating new roles, CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges potential workforce reduction due to increased automation.

title: Farah Khan asks Munawar Faruqui to compare his jail term and Bigg Boss
description: In a recent vlog with Farah Khan, Munawar Faruqui candidly discussed his experiences, drawing a stark contrast between his time in jail and his Bigg Boss journey, emphasizing the incomparable nature of the two.

title: IND v ENG: 'It's unbelievable' - Siraj joins Kapil in elite club with sensational spell
description: Mohammed Siraj etched his name in Indian cricket history, securing a remarkable 6/70 against England at Edgbaston. This feat places him among legends like Kapil Dev and Ishant Sharma. Siraj's performance is the best by an Indian at the ground since 1986.

title: 'India has navigated uncertainty very well, exports may top $870bn': Piyush Goyal
description: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal anticipates record exports, driven by FTAs, despite global uncertainties. Investment is flowing into key sectors, with a focus on value-added and labor-intensive exports. The government is reviewing FTAs with Asean and Japan, while remaining cautious on trade relations with China, aiming for fair and balanced trade.

title: 2020 election loss, assassination attempt: Trump shares 'best life evolution' video - watch
description: Donald Trump, in a video released on July 4th, acknowledged his 2020 election defeat for the first time. The video, titled ‘Best life evolution video of President Donald J Trump,’ chronicles his life from childhood to his business and political career.

title: LeBron James responds after viral Cleveland Cavaliers' photo triggers Lakers exit rumors
description: A photo sparked rumours of LeBron James returning to Cleveland Cavaliers. James clarified he was simply training in his hometown. He remains committed to Los Angeles Lakers. He opted into his contract. The Lakers reshaped their roster. James' agent said he wants another championship. Insiders say the Cavaliers are not interested in a reunion. The Lakers aim for stability.

title: Months before AI Dreamliner crash, DGCA warned Air India Express on Airbus engine fixes
description: Air India Express faced DGCA scrutiny for allegedly falsifying compliance documents related to Airbus A320 engine maintenance, following a European Union Aviation Safety Agency directive. The airline reportedly missed deadlines for replacing critical engine components, prompting internal disciplinary actions.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' day 15: Aamir Khan starrer sees a slight dip; inches closer to Rs 140 cr
description: Aamir Khan and Genelia D'Souza's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' released on June 20, 2025, continues its successful run, nearing ₹140 crore in domestic earnings after 15 days. Despite a minor drop on its second Friday, the film's occupancy rates improved, especially during evening and night shows. Aamir Khan expressed gratitude for the audience's warm reception and positive reviews.

title: Army deputy chief: Op Sindoor faced 3 foes - Pakistan, China & Turkiye
description: During Operation Sindoor, India faced a complex challenge with Pakistan, actively supported by China and Turkiye, according to a top Army officer. China provided Pakistan with real-time satellite intelligence on Indian military movements. Pakistan used Chinese weaponry, while Turkiye supplied drones. The conflict highlighted the need for improved C4ISR, air defense, and civil-military fusion.

title: National interest, not deadline, to dictate US trade deal: Piyush Goyal
description: India will only agree to a trade deal with the US if it safeguards national interests and provides a sustainable tariff advantage, according to Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Prioritizing farmers' interests, India aims for duty concessions in labor-intensive sectors like leather and textiles.

title: Free sanitary pad packs with Rahul Gandhi's pic stir Bihar poll row
description: Congress's initiative to distribute sanitary pads with Rahul Gandhi's image in Bihar sparked controversy, drawing criticism from NDA leaders who deemed it an insult to women. The scheme, aimed at promoting menstrual hygiene, faced backlash as opponents questioned the appropriateness of featuring a male figure on sanitary products.

title: Lord Ram, Bihar common thread as PM Modi addresses diaspora in Port of Spain
description: Addressing the Indian diaspora in Port of Spain, PM Modi highlighted the shared roots in Bihar, particularly referencing PM Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki beti." He acknowledged the hardships faced by indentured laborers and praised their enduring faith, especially their devotion to Lord Ram.

title: 2 girls among top 3 in CUET-UG, Delhi boy bags second position
description: The CUET-UG 2025 results saw two women among the top three, with Ananya Jain leading. Despite high scores, candidates are questioning syllabus deviations, errors, and the normalisation process. While registrations increased slightly, the number of test-takers declined, and fewer universities participated amid concerns about the exam's framework. Frustration persists over discrepancies, especially in the physical education paper.

title: Herald case against Sonia Gandhi 'truly strange': Abhishek Singhvi in court
description: Abhishek Manu Singhvi, representing Sonia Gandhi, argued in a Delhi court that the ED's National Herald case is a peculiar money-laundering case lacking property movement or gains for Congress leaders. He questioned the 11-year delay between AJL's restructuring and ED's action, asserting that no property shifted from Associated Journals Ltd to Young Indian Pvt Ltd.

title: Kangana Ranaut vs Jairam Thakur on Mandi floods?: BJP MP clarifies on her absence
description: A BJP feud surfaces in flood-hit Himachal Pradesh as MP Kangana Ranaut claims Jairam Thakur advised her to delay visiting Mandi due to connectivity issues, contradicting his earlier criticism of her absence. Chief Minister Sukhu seized on the apparent discord between the two leaders. The state government announced relief measures for affected families, including rental assistance and food supplies.

title: After IAF, Navy gets 1st woman fighter pilot
description: Following the IAF's lead, the Navy is preparing its first woman fighter pilot. Sub-Lieutenant Aastha Poonia received her "Wings of Gold" after completing transitional fighter training on Hawk advanced jet trainers. She will now undergo extensive training on MiG-29K fighters, potentially becoming the first woman to operate from an aircraft carrier, marking a significant milestone for women in naval aviation.

title: Kiren Rijiju attends Dalai Lama birthday celebrations; visit amid India-China war of words over spiritual leader's 'successor' - watch video
description: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju and Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu attended the Dalai Lama's birthday celebrations in Dharamshala, following a dispute between China and India over his succession. China urged India to handle Tibet-related issues cautiously after Rijiju stated the Dalai Lama's reincarnation should be his own decision. The MEA clarified India's neutrality on the selection process, emphasizing religious freedom.

title: J&K: Five Amarnath convoy buses collide in Ramban district; 36 pilgrims injured
description: Near the Chanderkot Langer site, five buses in a convoy of Amarnath pilgrims collided on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway, resulting in minor injuries to 36 pilgrims. The incident occurred around 8 am as the buses traveled from Jammu to Pahalgam. Injured pilgrims received immediate medical attention at Ramban district hospital, and alternative transportation was arranged for their onward journey.

title: NHAI to carry out feasibility of 2 new links to declog central Delhi
India-US trade deal: Rahul Gandhi reacts to Piyush Goyal's 'national interest' remark; claims PM Modi to 'meekly bow' before Trump
description: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi, anticipating he would yield to Trump's tariff deadline amid US trade talks. Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to protecting its national interests, particularly for farmers and industries, during negotiations. While the US seeks tariff reductions on agricultural products, India aims for concessions in labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather.

title: SC to decide validity of Madras HC stay on Tamil Nadu law on University VC appointments
When Raj meets Uddhav (again): Thackerays to hold joint 'victory' rally today; reunite over Hindi 'imposition'
description: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray are set to share a stage after 20 years for a joint rally celebrating the withdrawal of government resolutions related to the three-language policy. The rally, organized by Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS, marks a rare instance of unity between the cousins, focusing on Marathi language and identity.

title: Tejashwi wants Aadhaar as SIR proof; Election Commission says Aadhaar proves identity, not citizenship
description: Tejashwi Yadav, leading the INDIA bloc, challenged Bihar's electoral roll revision, deeming it 'anti-democratic'. They urged inclusion of Aadhaar, ration, and MGNREGA cards for voter verification, questioning Aadhaar's exclusion despite its prior acceptance. The Election Commission clarified Aadhaar's lack of citizenship proof and cited Trinamool Congress's opposition to linking it with voter IDs.

title: 87% enumeration forms distributed in Bihar; 5% filled up & returned; documents can be added later
In land of minerals and Maradona: PM Modi arrives in Argentina; what’s on agenda, why visit matters
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Argentina marks the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 57 years, aiming to strengthen ties in areas like energy, critical minerals, and trade. Discussions with President Javier Milei will focus on cooperation in agriculture, mining, and renewable energy, with India eyeing Argentina's shale reserves and lithium resources for energy security.

title: India has no position on Dalai Lama succession, says government; EAM to visit China
description: India has clarified its stance on the Dalai Lama's succession, stating it doesn't take a position on religious matters, despite a minister's personal support for the Dalai Lama's wishes. This comes as China cautioned India against interfering in Tibetan affairs, a comment later omitted from their official briefing transcript.

title: To restore key Gandhian sites, IGNCA unveils Rs 45 crore project
description: The Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts (IGNCA) is embarking on a Rs 45 crore project to conserve Gandhian heritage sites in Wardha, Maharashtra. Collaborating with MGIRI, the 18-month initiative aims to restore Gandhi Smriti Bhavan, Kasturba Kitchen, and Wardha Haat.

title: Army deputy chief: Operation Sindoor faced 3 foes - Pakistan, China & Turkiye
description: During Operation Sindoor, India faced a complex challenge with Pakistan, actively supported by China and Turkiye, according to a top Army officer. China provided Pakistan with real-time satellite intelligence on Indian military movements. Pakistan used Chinese weaponry, while Turkiye supplied drones. The conflict highlighted the need for improved C4ISR, air defense, and civil-military fusion.

title: HC junks plea to monitor ED probe against builder
description: The Delhi High Court has greenlit the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) investigation into real estate firm IREO Residences, dismissing allegations of bias. Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora reprimanded petitioner Gulshan Babbar for withholding crucial information and imposed a ₹1.25 lakh penalty for misleading the court.

title: RSS discusses role in crises, war-like drills
description: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) convened a three-day meeting in Delhi to discuss the potential role of its members in emergencies, including war-like scenarios and civil defense exercises. Discussions also addressed concerns regarding alleged atrocities against Hindus in Bangladesh and Bengal. The meeting involved reviewing organizational progress and planning for the centenary celebrations.

title: 'It's unbelievable': Siraj joins Kapil in elite club with sensational spell
description: Mohammed Siraj etched his name in Indian cricket history, securing a remarkable 6/70 against England at Edgbaston. This feat places him among legends like Kapil Dev and Ishant Sharma. Siraj's performance is the best by an Indian at the ground since 1986.

title: USOPC calls for immediate resignation of USA cricket board
description: The US Olympic & Paralympic Committee is pushing for a complete leadership change within USA Cricket, urging all independent directors to resign immediately. This action follows concerns over governance and financial management since USA Cricket's inception in 2018.

title: Edgbaston’s wild ride: Six ducks, two centurions, and one fiery fifer
description: India endured a punishing day at Edgbaston as Harry Brook (158) and Jamie Smith (184) stitched a mammoth 303-run stand, rescuing England from 25/3 to a defendable 407. Despite six ducks, India’s somewhat erratic bowling allowed the hosts back in. Mohammed Siraj’s fiery six-wicket haul, including a late burst, gave India a 180-run lead and a sliver of hope.

title: Watch: Cummins defies gravity in stunning catch: 'Effort of the highest class'
description: Pat Cummins's sensational caught-and-bowled dismissal of Keacy Carty highlighted a day dominated by bowlers in the second Test between Australia and West Indies. Cummins' athletic effort, described as world-class, removed Carty for 6. West Indies were restricted to 253, with Nathan Lyon taking 3 wickets, before Australia closed Day 2 on 12 for two.

title: Akash Deep opens up on Gautam Gambhir's pep talks
description: Mohammed Siraj's six-wicket haul and Akash Deep's four wickets helped India bowl out England for 407, securing a 180-run first-innings lead. Harry Brook and Jamie Smith's strong partnership was broken by the Indian bowlers. At stumps, India were 64 for 1, extending their lead to 244, with Akash Deep crediting Gautam Gambhir and Morne Morkel for boosting his confidence.

title: 'I was hungry to get a hundred': Harry Brook
description: Jamie Smith's record-breaking 184* and Harry Brook's 158 powered England's fightback from 84/5, but India maintained control on Day 3 of the second Test at Edgbaston. Siraj (6/70) and Akash Deep (4/88) dismantled the rest of the English batting lineup, securing a substantial 244-run lead for India, who ended the day at 64/1.

title: Controversy! Yashasvi takes late DRS call; Stokes clashes with umpire
description: Tensions flared on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test when Yashasvi Jaiswal was given out LBW, prompting a late review. England captain Ben Stokes contested the timing of the DRS call, leading to a heated discussion with the umpires and KL Rahul. Despite the drama and crowd's reaction, the review confirmed Jaiswal's dismissal.

title: After Afridi and Warner, Smith sets epic record vs India
description: Jamie Smith's explosive, unbeaten 150 rescued England from a dire situation at 84/5 on Day 3 against India at Edgbaston. Smith's counterattacking innings, achieved in just 144 balls, marks the fifth-fastest 150 by an English batter in Test history. His aggressive strokeplay and rapid century shifted the momentum, leaving the Indian bowling attack struggling to contain him.

title: Scary scene! Shubman Gill takes nasty blow to the head
description: During the second Test against England, Indian captain Shubman Gill was struck on the head while fielding, causing immediate concern. Fortunately, after treatment, he resumed playing. This incident followed Gill's emotional high after receiving messages from his parents, celebrating his record-breaking double century, marking a significant milestone in his career and India's Test history in England.

title: IND vs ENG: Siraj, Akash Deep mayhem hands England unwanted record for most ducks
description: India fought back on Day 3 of the second Test against England at Edgbaston, capitalizing on the second new ball to dismantle England's momentum after a formidable 303-run partnership between Jamie Smith and Harry Brook. Akash Deep's crucial breakthrough triggered a collapse, leading to England losing their last five wickets cheaply.

title: Bumrah bursts into laughter at Ravi Shastri's on-air comment
description: During the second Test at Edgbaston, Jasprit Bumrah was spotted in the Indian dugout wearing a radio earwig, drawing attention from commentator Ravi Shastri. India, after scoring 587, watched as England's Harry Brook and Jamie Smith formed a strong partnership. Mohammed Siraj's impressive 6/70 helped India bowl England out for 407, securing a significant first-innings lead.

title: Worst in 148 years! Prasidh Krishna sets unwanted Test record
description: India initially dominated Day 3 of the second Test, dismissing key England batsmen early. However, Jamie Smith and Harry Brook launched a stunning counterattack, scoring centuries and shifting the momentum. Their aggressive batting dismantled India's bowling strategy, particularly punishing Prasidh Krishna, whose expensive spell highlighted concerns about India's pace attack.

title: IND vs ENG: Jamie Smith breaks all-time England record
description: Jamie Smith's remarkable unbeaten 184 against India at Edgbaston has etched his name in England's Test history, surpassing Alec Stewart's long-standing record. Walking in at a critical juncture, Smith's innings rescued England from 84/5, forging a 303-run partnership with Harry Brook. Despite Smith's heroics, India secured a commanding lead, with Mohammed Siraj's impressive 6 for 70 further solidifying India's position.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi watches Edgbaston Test, reveals his role model
description: VVS Laxman orchestrated a valuable experience for India's U19 cricketers, arranging their visit to the Edgbaston Test to witness Shubman Gill's impressive innings. Coach Hrishikesh Kanitkar emphasized the importance of learning red-ball cricket techniques from Gill's masterful approach. Young players like Vaibhav Suryavanshi and Anmoljeet Singh expressed inspiration, fueling their aspirations to represent India after watching Gill's performance.

title: 'New shot, huh?' - Rishabh Pant pokes fun at Harry Brook after ENG batter does unthinkable - Watch
description: Harry Brook and Jamie Smith's sensational centuries powered England's remarkable recovery from 84/5 against India after Ben Stokes' golden duck. Smith's aggressive century, the joint-third fastest in Tests for England, and Brook's fluent 158 combined for a massive 303-run partnership.

title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over
description: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest — 354 runs in 14 games — his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.

title: 'Drag India forward like Kohli' – Vaughan's challenge to Gill, Jaiswal, Pant
description: Michael Vaughan believes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant must collectively fill the void left by Virat Kohli's departure from Test cricket. Vaughan acknowledged their potential but emphasised the need to replicate Kohli's intensity and global dominance to maintain India's competitive edge. He cautioned against underestimating the impact of losing Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

title: Flight delays, cancellations as French air traffic controller strike continues
description: French air traffic controllers continued strike action for a second consecutive day, causing the cancellation of 40 percent of flights across all Paris airports on Friday and disrupting travel plans for holidaymakers at the height of Europe's travel season.

title: Controversial West African activist Kemi Seba detained in Paris
description: Kemi Seba, a controversial African activist known for his virulent anti-Western stance, has been arrested in Paris, a source close to the case told AFP Tuesday.

title: France’s new health pass rules raise questions as many scramble to adapt
description: While the extension of France’s health pass and other new anti-Covid 19 measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron Monday night are yet to be hammered out in detail, what’s certain is that a full-throttled return to a normal life of frequenting café terraces, restaurants, cinemas, theatres and other culture and leisure activities will now hinge on having a pass sanitaire (or health pass).

title: Daughter loses legal case in bitter Asterix family feud
description: A long-running family feud between Asterix co-creator Albert Uderzo and his daughter took a new twist on Tuesday after judges dismissed a claim by Sylvie Uderzo that her father was mentally frail and being exploited.

title: Sarkozy’s legal woes roll on despite court ruling
description: A probe into claims Nicolas Sarkozy received illegal funding for his successful 2007 presidential campaign has been dropped. But as he considers a political comeback, several other cases threaten serious damage to his reputation.

title: African troops march with French for Bastille Day
description: The famed military parade for Bastille Day on Paris’s Champs-Elysées Sunday featured African troops who assisted France in its Mali operation against Islamist rebels. However, some have criticised the African presence as a sign of neo-colonial ties.

title: French conservatives defeat far right in tight by-election
description: France’s conservative UMP party narrowly defeated the far-right National Front in a by-election on Sunday, with candidate Jean-Louis Costes (pictured) winning the seat vacated by disgraced Socialist MP Jérôme Cahuzac following a tax evasion scandal.

title: Record number of women and minorities in new French parliament
description: With more women and members of foreign descent than any previous National Assembly, France's newly-elected parliament has moved a step closer to mirroring French society, even as ethnic-minority groups demand more diversity in politics.

title: New poll gives Sarkozy first round election lead
description: An opinion poll for the first time Tuesday put French President Nicolas Sarkozy ahead of Socialist rival François Hollande for the April 22 first round of presidential elections but showed Hollande would win a run-off vote on May 6.

title: Socialist candidate drums up support in French tropics
description: Socialist presidential hopeful Francois Hollande and President Nicolas Sarkozy will both visit French overseas regions Martinique, Guadeloupe, and French Guiana in upcoming weeks, with Hollande kicking off the charm offensive first.

title: Violent protests have ‘weakened unions’ in retirement battle
description: As the French government gets closer to signing a law that will raise the retirement age in France from 60 to 62, a leading French labour expert says violent clashes between youths and police have undermined the unions’ position.

title: Left-wing alliance trumps Sarkozy’s party in regional polls
description: The ruling UMP party of President Nicolas Sarkozy experienced a wipeout in the second round of France’s regional elections, with the Socialists and their left-wing allies winning in all but one of mainland France's 22 regions.

title: Top contemporary French artist Christian Boltanski dies aged 76
description: Christian Boltanski, one of France's top contemporary artists whose multimedia works probed the meaning of mortality and memory, has died aged 76, a former museum director told AFP on Sunday.

title: ‘France is your homeland’, Hollande tells French Jews
description: French President François Hollande announced tough new measures to combat anti-Semitism on Tuesday as he marked the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp with a visit to Paris's Holocaust memorial.

title: World leaders arrive in France for D-Day celebrations
description: Seventy years after the first Allied planes set off for the World War II invasion of Normandy, world leaders descended on France Thursday to remember the dead and commemorate D-Day in two days of memorial celebrations.

title: French court drops probe into Sarkozy campaign cash
description: A French court on Monday dropped a formal investigation into illegal campaign financing by former president Nicolas Sarkozy, who had been under investigation since March for allegedly accepting funds from L'Oréal heiress Liliane Bettencourt.

title: US consultant admits role in France's 'Karachi affair'
description: A US political consultant has admitted being paid by an intermediary in 1994 arms sales for advising the campaign of French presidential hopeful Édouard Balladur. The admission may shed new light on the scandal known as the “Karachi affair”.

title: French far-right shames Socialists in by-election
description: The far-right National Front has moved on to the second round of a parliamentary by-election to replace disgraced former MP Jérôme Cahuzac. The victory is an embarrassing blow to the Socialist government of President François Hollande.

title: Greens secure ‘historic’ gains in French parliamentary poll
description: France’s Green party won 17 seats in the country’s general election Sunday, an unprecedented score that makes it prominent enough to form its own parliamentary group, giving it more clout in political decision-making.

title: 'Lust’ is not a crime, say Strauss-Kahn lawyers
description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn’s lawyers have said their client, placed under formal investigation Monday for alleged involvement in a prostitution ring, was being hounded for “the offence of lust” which is “not forbidden in the penal code”.

title: Who will be France’s next first lady, or gentleman?
description: A singer, a journalist, a housewife or a plasterer’s son: who will move into the Elysée Palace in May, and can candidates count on their partners to help them get there? FRANCE 24 takes a look at who might be France’s next first lady… or gentleman.

title: Who's on strike in France?
description: Numerous industry sectors have joined the growing strikes against French President Nicolas Sarkozy’s unpopular pension reforms. Here are the sectors causing the most disruption.

title: Roma expulsion orders called into question by lawyers
description: In the Parisian suburb of Montreuil, 14 Roma men were ordered to leave French territory after a police roundup in August. Lawyers say their case proves the government is behind a discriminatory and illegal policy of expulsions.

title: Left-leaning parties form alliance to keep lead in second round
description: Ahead of a March 21 run-off vote, France’s Socialists allied with the Greens and other left leaning parties in a deal struck on Tuesday following the Socialists’ first-place showing in round one of regional elections.

title: In search for French heroes, Macron blunders – again
description: France’s embattled leader saw a week of World War I commemorations as a chance to reconnect with the French and highlight the danger of nationalism. Instead, his comments about Marshal Pétain gave further evidence of his tendency to shock and dismay.

title: France makes 323 arrests since start of Euro 2016 championship
description: French police have made 323 arrests since the start of the European Championships, the interior ministry said on Thursday, as Europe's showcase football event continues to be marred by violence.

title: Sarkozy ensnared in Bettencourt scandal
description: Former president Nicolas Sarkozy will remain under formal investigation in a case involving suspected illegal campaign donations by France’s richest woman, Liliane Bettencourt, after judges dismissed a motion to throw out a key medical report.

title: French ministers disclose personal wealth for first time
description: French authorities published the personal wealth of ministers on the government website on Monday in a bid to restore public confidence following a tax-evasion scandal which led to the resignation of former budget minister Jérôme Cahuzac.

title: Socialists free to push through reform agenda
description: The resounding Socialist Party victory in Sunday's parliamentary elections will allow new French President François Hollande to follow through with promised economic reforms to stimulate growth across Europe, a senior minister said Monday.

title: DSK under investigation in prostitution inquiry
description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former head of the IMF and a prominent French Socialist, has been placed under formal investigation for his alleged involvement in a prostitution ring, his lawyer said Monday.
